history.content: I think the question you should be asking yourself is if you have the necessary skills to be a data analyst. Not having experience will make it difficult for you to get noticed but if you can demonstrate that you have what it takes (through projects, clubs, etc.), its definitely possible.

I'm going to be graduating next semester, and I was wondering if anyone here was able to  or if it is possible to land a Data Science/ Data Analyst job with no relevant experience??

I have had internships in the past, but they were not related to Data Science or software engineering :(.

Would appreciate any advice, because I'm freaking out!

Thanks!

PS: I'm a Data Science major
history.subject: Getting a Data Science/ Data Analyst job as a new grad without any relevant experience
